column4: UPDATE 1-BP agrees to pay Texas $50 million for pollution
column5: * BP admits no liability for the pollution     * Agreement must be approved by state judge      By Erwin Seba     HOUSTON  Nov 3 BP Plc's  U.S. subsidiary has agreed to pay $50 million in civil penalties to the state of Texas for pollution from its Texas City refinery  including the deadly March 2005 explosion  state Attorney General Greg Abbott said.     The fine is equal to the amount BP Products North America paid in 2009 to the federal government for pollution from the explosion
